toc_entry.title: A Legacy Of Evil
toc_entry.description: In the town George Parr once dominated, a nineteen-year-old mother was gang-raped by her neighbors. In the aftermath of the crime, the old horrors of San Diego have surfaced anew.

toc_entry.title: Do I Make a Difference?
toc_entry.description: A kindergarten teacher tells what she learned in school.

toc_entry.title: I’M Right And Everyone In Texas Is Wrong
toc_entry.description: They don’t use air conditioning, they don’t drive cars, they don’t watch football —yet they dare to call themselves Texans.

toc_entry.title: Air Conditioning? Who Needs It?
toc_entry.description: It’s this simple: people’s teeth should not chatter in the summer.

toc_entry.title: Cars? No Thanks, i’d Rather Walk
toc_entry.description: You pay for interest, gas, oil, repairs, and insurance. I pay for shoe leather.

toc_entry.title: Football? What’s the Big Deal?
toc_entry.description: as much as I hated playing football, I hate watching it more.

toc_entry.title: Posed For Posterity
toc_entry.description: The portraits of a long-forgotten studio photographer yield images of dignity in a small Texas town. .

toc_entry.title: Hot Pots
toc_entry.description: How did bluebonnets and cacti get that glazed look?.

toc_entry.title: Off the Road Again
toc_entry.description: Willie Nelson’s Fourth of July Picnic at Carl’s Corner was the picnic to end all picnics. It did just that.
toc_entry.byline: by Willie Nelson with Bud Shrake

toc_entry.title: Bush Vs. Bentsen
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: Eighteen years after their Senate race determined the course of Texas politics, their rivalry may determine the course of national politics.

toc_entry.title: Getting Serious
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: as ann Richards joked her way to political stardom in atlanta, Jim Mattox wasn’t laughing.

toc_entry.title: Against All Odds
toc_entry.subtitle: Health
toc_entry.description: When the doctor told me my third child had Down’s syndrome, I knew that my life had changed forever.

toc_entry.title: When Words Collide
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: at the opera house back on Earth, music sometimes overwhelms sense. But on Planet 8 you couldn’t hear the music for the words.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Getting more bang for the buck; remembering a muddy, moody river; banking on Texas; sharing a Texas tradition.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: REPORTER
toc_entry.description: Channel 5 in Fort Worth hits forty; Elvis fever hits Waco; a would-be DA hits a snag in Raymondville; the Hangs Book is a hit with fishermen.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: The air Force takes over Big Bend; NCNB takes over First Republic; Dukakis takes over Bentsen; and who will take an empty Senate seat?.
